title: JupyterLite Schema v0
description: a schema for user-serviceable customizaton of a JupyterLite

top.title: JupyterLite Configuration
top.description: a user-serviceable file for customizing a JupyterLite site

jupyter-lite-schema-version.description: version of the schema to which the instance conforms

jupyterlab-settings-overrides.title: JupyterLab Settings Overrides
jupyterlab-settings-overrides.description: A map of config objects keyed by `@org/pkg:plugin` which override the default settings. See https://jupyterlab.readthedocs.io/en/stable/user/directories.html#overridesjson

^(@[a-z0-9-~][a-z0-9-._~]*/)?[a-z0-9-~][.description: A valid configuration which must conform to the plugin's defined schema

jupyter-config-data.title: Jupyter Config Data
jupyter-config-data.description: contents of a jupyter-config-data `<script>`, as read by `PageConfig`. These well-known values may be augmented by other extensions.

appName.description: The application name, as would appear in a Help menu

baseUrl.description: base URL of this JupyterLite, must end in `/`, will be expanded by `config-utils.js` to include a leading `/`

fullLabextensionsUrl.description: path to federated extensions, a folder organized by `({:org}/){package}`

fullWebRtcSignalingUrls.description: WebSocket URLs to use for finding WebRTC peers

mathjaxConfig.description: a valid MathJax configuration blob, a comma-delimited list of MathJax profiles

fullStaticUrl.description: relative path to built static assets

enableMemoryStorage.description: enable memory storage fallback which can lose data if the page is reloaded

contentsStorageDrivers.description: names of the localforage driver for contents, or `null` for the best available

contentsStorageName.description: name used to store Jupyter contents in the browser

settingsStorageDrivers.description: names of the localforage driver for settings, or `null` for the best available

settingsStorageName.description: name used to store Jupyter settings in the browser

disabledExtensions.description: Lab extensions (or specific plugins) to disable

litePluginSettings.description: Additional configuration options for jupyterlite plugins, keyed by npm-compatible name

retroPage.description: The page corresponding the named Notebook Classic UI section

exposeAppInBrowser.description: Whether to make the top-level Application instance available as ``window.jupyterapp``

collaborative.description: Whether to enable collaborative editing over WebRTC. Should be paired with the ``?room=<room name>`` URL parameter

pyolite-settings.description: Pyodide-specific configuration values. Will be defined in another location in the future.

pyodideUrl.description: The path to the main pyodide.js entry point

disablePyPIFallback.description: Disable the piplite behavior of falling back to https://pypi.org/pypi/

pipliteUrls.description: Paths to PyPI-compatible API endpoints for wheels. If ending in ``all.json``, assumed to be an aggregate, keyed by package name, with relative paths

non-trailing-slash-uri.title: A URI what doesn't end in /

extension.description: path to the extension module to load, relative to the extension's `package.json`

mimeExtension.description: path to the mime extension module to load, relative to the extension's `package.json`

load.description: path to the WebPack 5-compatible `remoteEntry*.js` file describing the bundle

style.description: path to the optional style module provided by the extension

npm-package-name.title: An NPM Package Name
npm-package-name.description: package.json-compatible extension name, with an optional organization prefix. See https://github.com/dword-design/package-name-regex/blob/master/src/index.js

lab-extension-plugin-name.title: A JupyterLab Plugin
lab-extension-plugin-name.description: a package.json-compatible extension name followed by a colon (:) and a specific plugin name

localforage-driver.title: A LocalForage Driver
localforage-driver.description: choose a storage driver from any number of localForage drivers

anyOf.title: custom
anyOf.description: use a custom driver added by a third-party plugin

anyOf.title: IndexedDB
anyOf.description: use the broadly-compatible IndexedDB key/value persistent store

anyOf.title: memory
anyOf.description: use the memory-based, volatile store: must be enabled with enableMemoryStorage
